markdownRemark.html:
Situated close to Steam Museum, the Lodge Park Walled Garden is constructed on the site of 1773 Palladian House. The garden is segregated into several parts, each of which has huge trees, beautiful plants and colourful flowers growing all around. Garden features boxed edge paths and herbaceous borders. The rose garden and vegetable area are also the attractions of the walled garden.

Tourists visiting the garden can also check out the nearby Steam Museum that exhibits the collection of engine used for distilleries and breweries. Visitors can indulge themselves in chocolate cake and some shopping at the gift shop located in the Steaming Kettle Tea Rooms.

Facilities: Morning coffee, lunch or tea in Steaming Kettle Tea House for the Pre-booked groups

Opening Times: Wed- Sun 2 – 6 pm, Jun-Aug, May and September by appointment only

Admission Charges: Adult €7.50, Children/OAP/Student/Group of Twenty €5, Family €20
